skill.name: code-reviewer
skill.description: Use when asked to review MERN stack code - comprehensive code reviewer that checks project health, security, maintainability, performance, testing, and architecture. Combines general code quality analysis with MERN-specific expertise.

skill.author: 9tykeshav

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only instructional markdown content. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access. All content is legitimate code review guidance with security-conscious patterns.

content.user_title: Review MERN code for security and quality
content.value_statement: Code reviews catch bugs before deployment but are time-consuming. This skill provides structured checklists, security patterns, and best practices for MERN stack reviews to ensure nothing critical is missed.
actual_capabilities: Checks project health before code review
Reviews MERN code for security vulnerabilities
Identifies maintainability issues like god files
Flags performance problems like N+1 queries
Offers fix suggestions with code examples
limitations: Does not execute or test code
Cannot access external APIs or databases
Only provides recommendations for manual fixes

use_cases.title: Review PR changes
use_cases.description: Check pull requests for security issues before merging to main branch

use_cases.title: Audit MERN security
use_cases.description: Scan Express and React code for OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities and injection flaws

use_cases.title: Ensure code quality
use_cases.description: Verify new code follows team standards for architecture and maintainability

prompt_templates.title: Quick PR Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the changes in my last commit. Check for security issues and MERN best practices.

prompt_templates.title: Full Project Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a full review of my MERN project. Start with project health, then review all key files for security and quality.

prompt_templates.title: Security Focus
prompt_templates.prompt: Focus on security review. Check for NoSQL injection, XSS, JWT issues, and hardcoded secrets.

prompt_templates.title: Architecture Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the architecture and structure of my MERN app. Check for god files, circular dependencies, and service layer patterns.

output_examples.input: Review my Express auth routes for security issues
output: Found 2 security issues: JWT tokens stored in localStorage (should be httpOnly cookies)
Rate limiting missing on login endpoint (recommend max 5 requests per 15 min)
Password logged in console.log statement - remove immediately
Missing Helmet middleware for security headers
Passed: Input validation present, bcrypt cost is 12, CORS properly configured

best_practices: Check project health first - build status, docs, and blockers before diving into code
Use structured output format with Critical, Important, and Suggestion categories
Apply reference files on-demand for MERN-specific edge cases
anti_patterns: Skipping project health checks and missing critical blockers
Classifying style issues as Critical severity
Claiming no issues found without actually searching for them

faq.question: What frameworks does this skill support?
faq.answer: MERN stack: MongoDB, Express, React, Node.js. Works with any JavaScript/TypeScript codebase.

faq.question: How deep does the code review go?
faq.answer: Adjusts depth based on scope: single file (deep), commit (medium), or full repo (broad sample).

faq.question: Does this skill modify my code?
faq.answer: No. It only provides recommendations and fix suggestions. You apply changes manually.

faq.question: Is my code sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. This is a prompt-based skill. Your code is processed locally by your AI tool only.

faq.question: Why did the review skip some files?
faq.answer: For full repo reviews, it samples key files. For targeted reviews, it focuses on changed files only.

faq.question: How is this different from linting tools?
faq.answer: Linters check syntax and style. This skill analyzes architecture, security patterns, and design decisions.
